PUBLICATIONS AND LAW CASES (Boxes 110-119)(See boxes 118 and 119 for works by Bell)
Derrick Bell Published articles in Journals 1956-1993 (bound and un-bound)

-The Education Digest, Feb 1981, "Redefining Racial Integration for Effectiveness" (2) -UConn Commencement Address, May 23, 1981, "Involuntary Career Challenges & The Equality Possibility" (3) -Michigan Law Review, 1981, Book Review " Britain, Blacks, and Busing" (3) -"Private Clubs & Public Judges: A Nonsubstantive Debate About Symbols," from Texas Law Review, April 1981 (3) -Alabama Law Review, Vol 32, No 2, Winter 1981, "The Dialectives of School Desegregation" (3) -The Yale Law Journal, Vol 90, No 8 July 1981 Book review of Bell Book Race, Racism and American Law (3) -The Yale Law Journal, Vol. 91, No. 4, March 1982, "Civil Rights Lawyers on the Bench BASS: Unlikely Heroes" (3) -Oregon Law Review, Vol 61, No 2, 1982, "Foreword" (3) -Journal of Law & Education April 1982 Book review of Bell book Shades of Brown: New Perspectives on School Desegregation - The 1983 James McCormick Mitchell Lecture, Bell Lecture "A Hurdle Too High: Class-based Roadblocks to Racial Remediation" (paper) -"Time for the Teachers: Putting Educators Back Into the Brown Remedy" from Journal of Negro Education, 1983 (2) -Phi Delta Kappan, April 1983, "Learning from our Loses: Is School Desegregation Still Feasible in the 1980s?" (2) -U.C. Davis Law Review, Vol 17, No 2, Winter 1984, "A Holiday for Dr. King: The Significance of Symbols in the Black Freedom Struggle" -Harvard Civil Rights Civil Liberties Law Review, Vol 19, No 2, Summer 1984, "A Tragedy of Timing" -Suffolk University Law Review, Vol. 18, No 3, Fall 1984, "An American Fairy Tale: The Income-Related Neutralization of Race Law Precedent" -Oregon Law Review, Vol 63, No. 4, 1984, "Introduction" (3) -The Supreme Court 1984 Term, "Foreword: The Civil Rights Chronicles" from Harvard Law Review, Nov 1985 (3) -Harvard Law Review, Nov 1985 The Supreme Court 1984 Term, "Foreword: The Civil Rights Chronicles" -Centerboard: The Journal of the Center for Human Relations Studies, Vol3, No 1, Spring 1985, "Is American Racism Economics by Another Name?"
